main event: A white object leaving a vapor trail was observed on September 12, 1954, in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, with reports of explosive disintegration and rainbow-colored appearances.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 minutes, with witnesses observing unusual motion of the object., The vapor trail from the object persisted for 20 minutes after its departure., There was local validation of the event, suggesting multiple witnesses., The report contains references to possible meteorological phenomena, like an exploding meteor., Other related sightings were reported in Las Cruces, New Mexico, and Enid, Oklahoma.
sighted object: a white object leaving a vapor trail
